alert.note: Alert for Apache Junction, Gold Canyon; Cave Creek, New River; Deer Valley; East Valley; Fountain Hills, East Mesa; New River Mesa; Pinal, Superstition Mountains; Rio Verde, Salt River; Scottsdale, Paradise Valley; Southeast Valley, Queen Creek (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 3:29PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Maricopa and Pinal Counties through 415 PM MST... At 328 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong outflow boundary ahead of thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles west of Horseshoe Reservoir to Camp Creek to 6 miles southeast of Desert Mountain to near Rio Verde to near Goldfield Ranch to Goldfield. Movement was southwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts 40 to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Mesa, Scottsdale, Gilbert, Apache Junction, Fountain Hills, East Mesa, New River, Cave Creek, Carefree, Granite Reef Dam, Falcon Field Airport, Lost Dutchman State Park, Goldfield, Usery Mountain Park, Superstition Mountains, Goldfield Ranch, Desert Mountain, Scottsdale Airport, Camp Creek and McDowell Mountain Park. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 17 between mile markers 240 and 241. US Highway 60 between mile markers 185 and 200. AZ Route 87 between mile markers 179 and 196. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
